perturbation.original_text: Aduro Biotech, Inc., with a place of business at 740 Heinz Avenue, Berkeley, CA 94710 ("Aduro") and IREYA B.V having an address at Staalwijkstraat 16, 2313 XR Leiden, the Netherlands, represented by Andrea van Elsas, ("Consultant") agree to all terms and conditions of this Consulting Agreement ("Agreement") dated June 1, 2020, effective as of July 1, 2020 ("Effective Date").
perturbation.changed_text: Aduro Biotech, Inc., with a place of business at 740 Heinz Avenue, Berkeley, CA 94710 ("Aduro") and IREYA B.V having an address at Staalwijkstraat 16, 2313 XR Leiden, the Netherlands, represented by Andrea van Elsas, ("Service Provider") agree to all terms and conditions of this Consulting Agreement ("Agreement") dated June 1, 2020, effective as of July 1, 2020 ("Effective Date").
perturbation.explanation: Changed 'Consultant' to 'Service Provider' in the opening paragraph. Later sections refer to 'Consultant,' so it is unclear if the 'Service Provider' is bound by the same obligations.

perturbation.original_text: Consultant's relationship to Aduro shall be that of an independent contractor. Consultant shall be responsible for the timely payment of his or her own self-employment and income taxes. Neither party shall have any authority to bind the other.
perturbation.changed_text: The Expert's relationship to Aduro shall be that of an independent contractor. Consultant shall be responsible for the timely payment of his or her own self-employment and income taxes. Neither party shall have any authority to bind the other.
perturbation.explanation: Replaced 'Consultant' with 'Expert' in the first sentence. The rest of the paragraph still refers to 'Consultant', creating confusion about who is responsible for what.

perturbation.original_text: From the Effective Date and for twelve (12) months after the termination of this Agreement (the "Restricted Period"), Consultant shall not, without Aduro's prior written consent, directly or indirectly, solicit or encourage any employee or contractor of Aduro or its affiliates to terminate employment with, or cease providing Services to, Aduro or its affiliates. In the event of a breach of this Paragraph 7 by Consultant, Aduro shall be entitled to entry of injunctive relief. Such injunctive remedy shall be nonexclusive and shall be in addition to any and all other remedies which may be available to it at law or in equity, including without limitation, the recovery of direct, indirect, incidental, consequential and/or punitive damages.
perturbation.changed_text: From the Effective Date and for twelve (12) months after the termination of this Agreement (the "Restricted Period"), the Advisor shall not, without Aduro's prior written consent, directly or indirectly, solicit or encourage any employee or contractor of Aduro or its affiliates to terminate employment with, or cease providing Services to, Aduro or its affiliates. In the event of a breach of this Paragraph 7 by Consultant, Aduro shall be entitled to entry of injunctive relief. Such injunctive remedy shall be nonexclusive and shall be in addition to any and all other remedies which may be available to it at law or in equity, including without limitation, the recovery of direct, indirect, incidental, consequential and/or punitive damages.
perturbation.explanation: Replaced 'Consultant' with 'Advisor' in the first sentence. The second sentence refers to 'Consultant' creating uncertainty whether the restrictive covenant applies to the 'Advisor'.
